post_title: This one person who has already given up on 2020
post_content:
Look forward to 2021 because 2020 is a wash. https://t.co/M4stxxfC0O

— Max Covill (@mhcovill) April 21, 2020
@mhcovill is done with 2020, and we can‚Äôt blame him. It has been a rough couple of months, and the movies might have been the only thing that could have made it better. Either way, 2021 is now going to be a year of redemption.
sub_category: DC Movies Get New Release Dates and the Internet Cant Keep Calm
sub_category_description: It is no surprise that DC-verse releases have been delayed. It is also no surprise, that the fans stormed social media with their enlivened thoughts and opinions. You were hyped to witness the new The Batman on the silver screen or find out how Steve Trevor returns from the dead. But then, Shazam! And everything got pushed to the future in a Flash. See what we did there? The announcement for the indefinite postponing of all movies witnessed DC universe fans at their opinionated best, whether they had theories to share, ideas to discuss, or hope to spread. In fact, even costuming got a few tweets dedicated to it. Take a look at what they had to say on Twitter and maybe add your own take too!

post_title: This user here believes good use can be made of the extra time
post_content:
Me, an intellectual:

WB can take the time they have during #TheBatman delay to redesign the costume üôÉ

Comments:

iT‚Äôs nOT tHAT bAD sNydER sHiLl i aCtUaLlY lIke it. BeSt BaTMaN eVEr

— Lindsey Staton (@LnSdreamer_98) April 21, 2020
@LnSdreamer_98 believes the costumes could do with a makeover during this lockdown. We know for sure this isn‚Äôt the perspective of just one, but many. According to Ranker, Jim Lee‚Äôs version of the Batsuit seemed to get the fans‚Äô approval.

post_title: How would that even be possible?
post_content:
I thought they postponed the release date from 1984 to something else

— DeJesus (@DeJesusLovesYou) March 24, 2020
@DeJesusLoves joked about misreading the tweet and thought the release date changed from 1984 to another year. It would be pretty cool to go back in time, watch the movie, and then see reviews from that time. Unrealistic expectations aside, postpone the movie no further, please.

post_content:

— Gal Gadot (@GalGadot) March 24, 2020

post_title: Hence proved: The Batman is a favorite, even in text
post_content:
Which comic book movie has you the most hyped? #DC #Marvel #WW84 #BlackWidow #TheBatman #Venom2 #SHPOLL20

— Chris Nichols (@LadyOfHelheim) April 20, 2020
Movies aside, @LadyOfHelheim held a Twitter poll to find out which comic book is the most popular amongst DC fans. The choices were Wonder Woman 1984, Black Widow, Venom 2, and The Batman. Turns out the bat flies high, even when it comes to comics.
